task_summary: Pickup the bowl and place it inside the kitchen cabinet by identifying both objects, grasping the bowl, opening the cabinet, and releasing the bowl inside.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robot arm interacting with a kitchen environment. The robot must locate a bowl on the counter, pick it up using its gripper, detect the kitchen cabinet, open the cabinet door, move the bowl above and inside it, and carefully place the bowl into the cabinet. The robot relies on visual cues and prehension to ensure a secure grasp and successful placement. Robust perception and manipulation are required to handle occlusions, proper alignment, and object transitions.
preconditions: Bowl is located on the counter, accessible and not occluded
Kitchen cabinet is closed and accessible
Robot gripper is empty and operational
Robot has clear access to bowl and cabinet
stepwise_plan: Detect the bowl on the counter using vision
Open gripper and position above bowl
Align and approach the bowl, grasp it securely
Confirm a successful grasp of the bowl
Locate the kitchen cabinet and open it
Move bowl above and inside the cabinet
Release the bowl into the cabinet
Retreat the gripper from the cabinet
success_criteria: Bowl is fully inside the kitchen cabinet
No collision or drop occurred during task
Cabinet is left open and accessible
failure_and_recovery: If bowl is not detected, rescan (up to 3 attempts)
If grasp fails, restart grasp sequence
If cabinet cannot be detected, rescan and retry
If cabinet fails to open, retry once
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates once bowl is released inside cabinet and robot retreats clear of the workspace

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Put the bowl inside the kitchen cabinet

node_specs.description: Checks if the bowl is visible to the perception system.
Performs an active scan to locate the bowl.
Executes detailed detection of the bowl.
Opens the gripper to receive the bowl.
Moves the gripper above the bowl.
Aligns and approaches the gripper to the bowl for grasping.
Closes the gripper with light force to pick up the bowl.
Checks bowl is stably in the gripper.
Checks if the cabinet is visible to the perception system.
Locates the cabinet in the workspace.
Opens the cabinet door for access.
Moves bowl above the cabinet interior.
Places the bowl inside the cabinet.
Opens gripper to release the bowl.

failure_modes: Perception failure (cabinet or bowl not detected)
recovery_strategy: Rescan bowl or cabinet up to 3 times
Repeat grasp or open if necessary
Pause and alert human if repeated failures
assumptions: Frames confirm cabinet must be opened before placing bowl; this may not be explicit from instruction.
Goal pose inside cabinet is derived from scene layout, not detailed in instruction.
Contact-sheet frames used as ground truth for action phasing.

expected_success_criteria: Robot arm clear of cabinet after placement
